intro: Rudgea minutifolia, commonly known as the dwarf rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Rudgea minutifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and subtle floral display.
